music and the music video. Sure, I totally get where all you Christian 
folks that are more traditional are coming from... It's not easy to get 
used to this kind of music in terms of worship. I came from a traditional 
Christian background - no drums, and no electric guitar. Just choir and 
piano. The thing is... You can't put Christianity in a box (more so, 
Jesus). There is a verse in the bible that says, "generation after 
generation will be in awe of Your works." I forgot where that is from, but 
to me it basically means that PEOPLE are gonna be constantly changing, but 
GOD does not. He is the same forever and always. Guys, we cant be critical

more ways to connect with people who are lost instead of just handing out 
tracts, right? God Bless, to anyone who got my point and are still reading 
this.﻿

comments.text:
+prsgirl Let us understand that Symbols means to define something, 
characterize, suggest or represent something else, whereas Symbolism is the 
act of using symbols. The Bible uses symbolism a lot, like the Lamb, that 
symbolizes Lord our Savior. And also, the fact that they refer Jesus as to 
having a sharp double-edged sword coming out of His mouth with Seven Stars 
in His right hand, the 7 Lampstands, with feet as bronze metal glowing in a 
furnace, (and more to refer), isn't that symbolism? If symbolism IS wrong, 
then why is the Holy Living Word of God, using symbolism to His children, 
when he could just be direct and use easier context for us to understand? 
If symbolism is wrong in the Bible, then are we worshiping a stupid god 
that is senseless to his mind that uses symbolism throughout almost the 
entire Bible most of the time? NO. And I am pretty sure what you meant by 
in the context of the Bible where symbolism is wrong, is that it is wrong 
to worship symbols or images. The Illuminati used the All Seeing Eye (AND 
NOT A PLAIN TRIANGULAR SHAPED SHAPE) to shove it down to us that they're 
everywhere, sees everything, is in control, and are powerful, as this world 
is 'ruled' by evil. (There are various other religions which worships 
images, but I can't name any).

You can't lust over something that's glorifying God, or focusing on God, or 
even related to God. The thing about glorifying themselves though, is a 
different matter that God and Hillsong should resolve among themselves, but 
ultimately, this song is pointing out to God. You can't lust music over God 
that when God is in the music itself, that's quite weird of a context to 
put out. It might be the case, but we shouldn't really care now, should we? 
This music is just a matter of genre, and it's still music used to glorify 
God. It's like praying to God in Chinese and English, both different 
languages, different ways of speaking to God, but still praising the same 
God in different ways. They worshiped God in different genres of music, but 
that doesn't make them NOT worshiping God. I personally like this type of 
Genre in Christian music, but that don't mean I'm worshiping the music, 
right? I personally dislike the type of worship in the 09's and older 
because I don't like it based on my taste in music as a youth, but that 
don't mean I hate God, right? 

The Bible tells us to be kind to one another,I don't really recommend you 
spreading out weird beliefs like the "Olympic torch that's co-related to 
this flare waved around the air by some kid that has nothing to do in his 
spare time* (emphasis added). Different sides of people's opinions based on 
their knowledge where they gained from are different, some are contradicts 
with each other, but since this is a Christian music video, I as a 
Christian will use a Christian point of view based on Christian analysis to 
describe this symbolic event of holding the torch/flare.

The flare held up by the young lad represents the burning passion or fire 
for God and of God, and that it is shinning brightness pierces trough 
darkness (night) and light (morning, both in the music video). It also 
means the glory of God which is (and should be) implemented in this lad 
(all of us, children of God), and that everyone else follows that glory. As 
you can see, some of them held up their hands to the Light, which is Jesus. 
The young lad with the flare was leading them, meaning the Way. All of 
this, concludes that it's the True God that's working in this music video. 
The light really just represents God and our burning passion for Him, the 
glory of God, and the Shining Morning Star, Jesus Christ Himself. 

I Hope this cleared up some of your understandings! Shalom and have a 
wonderful and blessed day!!!! :D

Love,
Johnson
(Brother-In-Christ)

comments.text:
+prototypMANIAC This video represents every day life of the youth of 
Australia. They are going surfing, having fellowship together at the beach, 
enjoying some skating, and showing what normal life looks like. (I know 
because I live in Sydney and I personally know some of the team in Y&F.) It 
represents how Jesus takes our burdens and brings us back to life. We don't 
live inside the walls of the church 7 days a week. We gain so much from 
being in the church and we take that and minister to people through what 
Jesus has imparted into us. A person's capacity to make music was created 
by God and man has distorted it for their own purposes. Why not recreate it 
and use it to glorify God? Why not meet young people where they are at and 
allow them to understand God by using music they identify with? It doesn't 
have to be either or. It can be both/and. We need all types of music in the 
church because there are so many people groups to be reached. What works 
for you might not work for someone else. We need to constantly be creative 
and work on music that reaches multiple people groups. These songs have the 
capacity to break the ice so that someone can feel completely comfortable 
entering in. It's great that you can enter in straight from the beginning. 
Some people need a few awesome, dance around praise songs to feel 
comfortable before getting vulnerable with God. #justsomethoughts
comments.author: robikins86

comments.text:
+prototypMANIAC You are very brave to say that you understand Bible very 
well... I think it was saint Augustine who said "If you think that you 
understand, then what you understand is not God" (sorry for my translation 
from my mother tongue). Basically what I mean - in this case you cannot 
tell exactly how we should worship. In the Bible what we can find is that 
God is looking for our hear, not if he likes guitar or piano and not if the 
video should show cross or celebration of life... I think this corresponds 
a bit with Daniel Nguyen's last paragraph.

Another point I really want to elaborate on: "And my question to you is 
since when do We need to change things to accomodate to other people to 
christ? People accomodate to christianity. God is not intersted in yur 
comfort or your prefrence. He is interested in your worship and if you know 
at least one thing aout God it is that He is a very specific God." 
I can't understand what's your point of view on evangelism... I look at 
Jesus and I see that He came to people where they were, in their 
circumstances, always talking with examples from their life... I look at 
Paul, how he preached in Athens (look around Acts 17 v23)... From this I 
learn that we should do everything to reach people in secular world! And 
THEN proclaim TRUE/FULL Gospel as opposed to "selling" it, i.e., offering 
just the nice parts: like eternal life, love, happiness, comfort, security, 
etc...
And finally, of course God is interested in my comfort and my wellbeing! He 
is MY FATHER! And because of that my praise goes to Him! And I know few 
things about God already... He loved first, He died for me, He knows my 
needs. I feel concerned about you if you think of God as of some demanding 
figure who doesn't care about you... but if you truly seek for truth, you 
will find it :)
And yes, God is very specific about some things, e.g., "Jesus said to him, 
I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father 
except through me." Different means of worship or evangelism.
comments.author: Indrute Smile
